page.title: 18GATTON - REIGATE/REDHILL
page.content:
{Gatton Park}includes 230 acres of mixed farmland where cows, horses and sheep graze. It also includes an 18th. century, man-made lake and grounds landscaped by Capability Brown.
Gatton Manor was mentioned in the {Domesday Survey of 1086}as Gatetune, and was held by a Saxon earl called Leofwin. It was passed to the Norman Bishop Odo, half brother to William the Conqueror, and then later to the crown. Ann of Cleaves held the manor after her divorce from Henry VIII.
In the grounds is the 12th century {church of St.Andrews}which is still used as a parish church. It has many treasures including the only Flemish prayer wood carving in the whole of England.
